metadata.Title: CVE-2023-4611 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - high.
metadata.Description:
A use-after-free flaw was found in mm/mempolicy.c in the memory management subsystem in the Linux Kernel. This issue is caused by a race between mbind() and VMA-locked page fault, and may allow a local attacker to crash the system or lead to a kernel information leak.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-4611` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.13.0-19-generic - 5.13.0-19.19
linux-image-5.13.0-19-generic-lpae - 5.13.0-19.19
linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-19-generic - 5.13.0-19.19
linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-19-generic-64k - 5.13.0-19.19
linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-19-lowlatency - 5.13.0-19.19
No subscription required

linux-image-5.19.0-1007-allwinner - 5.19.0-1007.7~22.04.1
No subscription required

No subscription required
